isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Engine Electrical - Remove

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, make sure the transmission is in neutral or park, parking brake is set, and wheels are blocked before doing diagnostic or service procedures on engine or vehicle.
To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, disconnect the main negative battery terminal before removing or installing any electrical components.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, make sure the key is in the OFF position before unplugging a connector or relay for the ECM, IDM, and EGR drive module. Failure to turn the key to the OFF position will cause a voltage spike and damage the electrical components.

To avoid engine damage, do not tug on any wiring harnesses while trying to remove them. If resistance is felt, find the source of resistance and free up any connectors or clips that are caught before proceeding.

note.para: Make sure each connector has its ribbed seal in place before connecting to sensor. In some cases, during disassembly, a ribbed seal may pull out of its connector and remain on the mating socket of a sensor or actuator. A connector assembled without appropriate ribbed seal can become contaminated with moisture and corrode terminals, resulting in poor electrical connection.
Removal procedures for the front-mounted or rear-mounted ECMs are identical except where noted.

When servicing Diamond Logic® controller, applying an approved dielectric grease to disconnected ECM connectors is encouraged. This will provide a protective, moisture tight seal that ensures ECM connectors will continue to perform effectively.

step1.para: Remove screws and connector cover shields from ECM connector covers.
Remove ECM connector covers from wiring harness connectors.
Loosen chassis wiring harness connector mounting bolt and remove wiring harness from ECM.
Loosen engine wiring harness connector mounting bolt.

figure.caption: Loosen wiring harness connector (front mount ECM)
Loosen wiring harness connector (rear mount ECM)

step1.para: Remove engine wiring harness from ECM.

figure.caption: Remove engine wiring harness (front mount ECM)
Remove engine wiring harness (rear mount ECM)

note.para: If ECM does not have to be removed from mounting bracket, proceed to Step 9.

step1.para: If it is necessary to remove ECM from mounting bracket, remove four ECM mounting bolts and lift ECM from bracket.

figure.caption: Remove bottom bracket bolts (front mount ECM)
Remove bottom bracket bolts (rear mount ECM)

step1.para: (Front mounted ECM) Remove three ECM mounting bracket top mounting nuts. Lift bracket away from engine.
(Rear mounted ECM) Remove two ECM mounting bracket top mounting bolts. Lift bracket away from engine.

figure.caption: ECM bushings, pins, and bolts (rear mount ECM)

step1.para: Remove mounting bracket bushings and pins, If required. See "Inspect and Test" in this section.

figure.caption: ECM bushings, pins and nuts (front mount ECM)
